title: China's strong demand for commodities to overtake post-2008 crisis, mining giant says
description: China's reopening will boost demand for commodities more significantly than it did after the 2008 financial crisis, says Andrew Forrest, executive chairman of Fortescue.

title: China's growing influence threatens to undermine global human rights, new research finds
description: China's growing global influence poses a serious threat to international human rights, according to a new report, which suggests the UNHRC is failing to counter such risks.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Nothing broke yesterday. Markets cheered
description: U.S. stocks rallied Wednesday as both banks and big tech rebounded. For markets still reeling from the banking crisis, no news is good news.

title: Electronic Arts is cutting about 800 jobs, or 6% of workforce, and reducing office space
description: Video game company Electronic Arts will lay off 6% of its workforce and reduce office space, costing the company around $200 million.

title: Apple announces its big annual conference, where it could reveal its new headset
description: WWDC also provides a preview of where Apple is heading because the company discusses its goals for software development and reveals new iPhone features.

title: We're halfway to a tipping point that would trigger 6 feet of sea level rise from melting of the Greenland Ice Sheet
description: New research on the melting of the Greenland Ice Sheet identifies tipping points defined by cumulative carbon emissions in the atmosphere.

title: ChatGPT and AI might have a future as your portfolio manager, study suggests
description: A preliminary paper from two academics in South Korea shows that ChatGPT has some promise as a portfolio manager.

title: Elon Musk and other tech leaders call for pause on 'dangerous race' to make A.I. as advanced as humans
description: Artificial intelligence labs have been urged by Elon Musk and numerous other tech industry figures to stop training AI systems more powerful than GPT-4.

title: Saudi Arabia takes step to join China-led security bloc, as ties with Beijing strengthen
description: The Saudi decision to join the China-led SCO comes within weeks of Beijing brokering talks for arch-rivals Tehran and Ryiadh to resume diplomatic relations.

title: Credit Suisse whistleblowers say Swiss bank has been helping wealthy Americans dodge U.S. taxes for years
description: The bank notoriously pleaded guilty in 2014 to criminal charges for "knowingly and willfully" helping U.S. clients hide offshore assets and income from the IRS.

title: 'Call of duty': With Sergio Ermotti, Switzerland gets a cost-cutting local to restore its reputation
description: New UBS CEO Sergio Ermotti on Wednesday said his return to the helm was "a call of duty," as the Swiss veteran takes on the task of restoring order to the country's bruised financial system.

title: Bitcoin climbs 5% above $28,000 as investors shrug off regulatory crackdowns
description: Bitcoin surged 5% in the past 24 hours to as high as $28,474, retaking the $28,000 level after dipping below it on Monday.

title: Alibaba's revamp puts renewed focus on Ant Group's suspended IPO
description: The latest overhaul in Alibaba's business announced overnight could be seen as calls for renewed interest for the $34.5 billion listing of Ant Group.

title: CNBC Daily Open: UBS gets a new (old) Group CEO
description: UBS gets a new Group CEO, and U.S. regulators said they favor more stringent rules on banks. Big changes are coming to banks.

title: UBS names Sergio Ermotti as its new Group CEO, following acquisition deal of Credit Suisse
With ChatGPT hype swirling, UK government urges regulators to come up with rules for A.I.
description: The U.K. published a white paper for artificial intelligence. The plans come as generative AI has driven hype around the technology to frenzied levels.

title: Israeli turmoil alarms business leaders: There's 'fear over what happens next'
description: The uncertainty afflicting Israel's political situation extends deep into the business sector.

title: Asia's 'best restaurants' list is out — and it's no surprise which country made the list 17 times
description: Japan is home to 17 of the region's "best" 100 restaurants, while Singapore and Thailand tied for second place with 15 restaurants on the list each.

title: U.S.-China tech rivalry will continue to put Chinese firms under intense scrutiny
description: Chinese companies will continue to face scrutiny from the U.S. as geopolitical tensions and competition will not ease soon, said a political analyst.

title: Alibaba shares soar 15% in Hong Kong on news of major overhaul
description: Alibaba in its announcement to split its company into six business groups is aimed to "unlock shareholder value."
